intro: Hedyotis shenzhenensis, commonly known as the Shenzhen dwarf mistletoe, is a parasitic plant native to China, specifically the Guangdong province. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clustered, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant relies on host trees for nutrients, typically growing on the branches of other plants. Its botanical significance lies in its unique ecological role and its status as a rare, endemic species.
